item.title: Gaussian Process Classification by Tensorflow-probability
item.description: In classification, people can model the class-conditional densities with a Gaussian, where \(x\) is the input features: \[ p(x|c) = N(\mu, \Sigma_c) \] In binary classification, a response function (or a link function) is used to turn the output of a regression model into class probability, so the domain of the output from a regression model is squashed into [0, 1] range. Common link function is logistic function (another one is probit function, which will not be discussed here):
